intro: Psychotria condorensis, commonly known as the Andean psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the cloud forests of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It often grows in shaded, humid environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Psychotria condorensis is also known for its potential ethnobotanical significance in traditional medicine.
